intro: Borreria densiflora var. minima, commonly known as the dwarf borreria, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant. Due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
